title: 'Gazab aadmi hai': Nitish's awkward garland moment goes viral; Tejashwi mocks CM
content: Tejashwi Yadav has questioned Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's fitness to lead, sharing a video of the CM struggling at a rally. Yadav also alleged Nitish's party might have deliberately incapacitated him. This renewed criticism comes as Assembly elections loom, with Yadav suggesting Nitish's behavior raises governance concerns.

title: 'Dated this obese woman': Decoding India hate in Young Republicans chat
content: ‚ÄãDuring the election, fewer Indian-Americans voted for Harris than they did for Democratic candidates like Biden, Clinton, or Obama. Even after the election, it appeared Indians were everywhere and integral to the Republican machine. Tulsi Gabbard, an honorary Indian, was now Director of National Intelligence. Sriram Krishnan was advising Trump on AI. Kash Patel was the FBI chief. But all of it appeared to be just veneer, and the contempt for the community continued unabated ‚Äî as evident during the MAGA Civil War, when the faithful attacked H-1B visa holders (mostly Indian-Americans) for Americans losing their jobs.

title: Bihar polls: Friendly fights or frayed ties? MGB's unity faces reality check
content: Bihar's Mahagathbandhan alliance is experiencing internal friction. Seat-sharing issues are causing confusion and overlapping nominations for the upcoming 2025 assembly elections. Smaller allies feel sidelined, with JMM withdrawing from the state-level arrangement. These coordination challenges could impact vote splits in key constituencies. Leaders are working to resolve disputes before polling begins.

title: Watch: 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi spotted bursting crackers on Diwali
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old cricket star, celebrated Diwali with fans after Bihar's Ranji Trophy victory. The young player, who also secured an IPL contract, is seen as a key figure in Bihar's cricket revival. Suryavanshi is expected to play in the upcoming ICC Under-19 World Cup. He is enjoying his moments off the field.

title: Proxy war? Kabul sets record straight with Pak; rejects India's role in conflict
content: Afghanistan's defence minister Mullah Yaqoob denies India's role in recent clashes with Pakistan.  Pakistan had accused India of backing the Taliban. India, however, states Pakistan blames neighbors for its failures.  India has reopened its embassy in Kabul, strengthening ties with Afghanistan.  This move signifies a growing diplomatic and economic relationship between the two nations.

title: AWS Outage: 15-hour internet disruption affect millions; What happened
content: A massive 15-hour Amazon Web Services outage on October 20 crippled thousands of popular apps and websites globally, including banking, gaming, and government services. The disruption stemmed from a critical Domain Name System (DNS) issue in AWS's primary US-EAST-1 data center, causing cascading failures. Experts highlight the need for companies to build better protection systems and emphasize that even minor infrastructure like DNS can cause widespread chaos.

title: Riding high: Lokpal floats tender for 7 luxury BMWs; request sparks outrage online
content: India‚Äôs top anti-corruption body, the Lokpal, has come under fire after issuing a tender to purchase seven luxury BMWs, sparking allegations of hypocrisy and misuse of taxpayers‚Äô money. Opposition leaders, activists, and social media users criticised the move, highlighting the irony of an institution created to fight corruption indulging in lavish spending.

title: Bihar polls: Mahua to Raghopur ‚Äî top 5 high-profile seats to watch out for
content: Bihar's 2025 assembly elections are set for a high-stakes contest on November 6 and 11. Key constituencies like Raghopur and Mahua will witness intense battles, including family strongholds and 'friendly fights' between INDIA bloc partners, highlighting the RJD-Congress vs. BJP-JD(U) rivalry.

title: Asia Cup row: Pak's Naqvi declines to hand over trophy again; BCCI to move ICC
content: India's Asia Cup victory remains marred by a trophy dispute, with ACC head Mohsin Naqvi refusing to release it to the BCCI. Despite requests from India, Afghanistan, and Sri Lanka, Naqvi insists on a BCCI representative collecting it from Dubai. The BCCI has rejected this, planning to raise the issue at an upcoming ICC meeting.

title: Moon mission update: Musk's SpaceX is behind schedule; NASA to reopen contract
content: NASA's acting chief, Sean Duffy, revealed SpaceX's Artemis III moon landing project is behind schedule. He emphasized a competitive approach, opening contracts for companies like Blue Origin to vie for the lunar return. Duffy aims for a mission within two years, driven by a desire to beat China to the moon under President Trump's term.

title: Days before his death, Daniel Naroditsky posted video with shocking title
content: American chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky has died at age 29, with the cause undisclosed. Known for his talent as a player, commentator, and educator, Naroditsky's passing has prompted questions and discussions within the chess community. His family remembered him for his passion and the joy he brought to the game.

title: Bihar polls: AIMIM fields non-Muslim candidates; what is Owaisi's strategy?
content: AIMIM has released its first list of 25 candidates for the Bihar assembly elections, notably including two non-Muslim nominees. This move signifies Asaduddin Owaisi's strategy to broaden the party's appeal beyond its traditional Muslim base and position it as a social justice platform for all communities, aiming to contest beyond the Seemanchal region.

title: Economic warning: JPMorgan CEO urges action; Says US too dependent on unreliable sources
content: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon is launching a $1.5 trillion, decade-long plan to bolster America's industrial strength and reduce foreign supply chain reliance.  The Security and Resiliency Initiative will target defense, frontier tech, energy, and advanced manufacturing, with the bank committing $10 billion to kickstart these vital sectors. Dimon urges immediate, unified action to secure the nation's future.

title: Govardhan Puja 2025: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes for loved ones
content: Govardhan Puja 2025 is approaching, a festival celebrating Lord Krishna's protection of Vrindavan. Devotees prepare to share heartfelt wishes and messages. The article offers 50 wishes, messages, and quotes for family, friends, and colleagues. It also provides tips on celebrating this auspicious day, including worship of Govardhan Hill and offering Annakut. This festival emphasizes devotion, humility, and gratitude.

title: Mitch Marner drops confident comment after first goals, shakes up Golden Knights
content: Mitch Marner's two-goal outburst against the Calgary Flames has revitalized the Vegas Golden Knights, propelling them to the top of the Pacific Division.  His return to form, coupled with a perfect power play performance, signals a strong start to his debut season in Vegas, promising exciting times ahead for the team and its fans.

title: Is Iran going nuclear again? Satellite images show rebuilt Taleghan-2 - what is it?
content: New satellite imagery reveals Iran is rebuilding Taleghan 2, a former nuclear weapons development site at Parchin, following its destruction in an October 2024 Israeli air strike. Construction resumed in May 2025, with a new structure emerging by August. This rebuilding escalates tensions and renews debate over diplomatic efforts to curb Iran's nuclear ambitions.

title: Stephen Curry reveals hilarious nickname for sister Sydel on her 31st birthday
content: Amidst personal speculations, Stephen and Ayesha Curry celebrated Sydel Curry Lee's 31st birthday. Stephen affectionately revealed his sister's nickname, 'Flossy,' in a heartwarming Instagram post. Sydel, an influencer, also shared a reflective message about her new life chapter, expressing gratitude for her community and family as she embraces turning 31.

title: Marcio Rubio faces backlash for 'Hindu-less' Diwali greeting
content: US Secretary of State Marco Rubio's Diwali message on X has drawn criticism for omitting any mention of Hindus, the festival's core community. Critics argue this dilutes Diwali's Hindu origins and feels dismissive, despite the message wishing joy and peace to all celebrants. The omission overlooks the festival's deep religious and cultural significance for Hindus worldwide.

title: Meet Sanae Takaichi, the 'iron lady' of Japan and first woman PM leading nation
content: Sanae Takaichi has become Japan's first female Prime Minister, elected leader of the LDP and approved by parliament. A prot√©g√© of Shinzo Abe, she inherits a complex landscape, focusing on economic stimulus, stronger defense, and assertive diplomacy, particularly concerning China and Taiwan. Her socially conservative and nationalist stance marks a historic milestone amid domestic and global pressures.

title: 'Defaming Diwali': BJP blames Punjab for Delhi's toxic air, says AAP made farmers burn stubble
content: Delhi Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa accused the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) of deliberately politicizing Diwali and Hinduism. He alleged that Arvind Kejriwal banned firecrackers to appease a specific community and that AAP leaders have been criticizing the festival. Sirsa emphasized that Diwali is a Sanatan Hindu festival, not a BJP one, questioning the AAP's negative stance.

title: After Daniel's death, Sarin blasts Kramnik - ‚ÄòBaseless accusations caused pain‚Äô
content: Indian Grandmaster Nihal Sarin has indirectly criticised Vladimir Kramnik following Daniel Naroditsky's death, citing relentless, baseless cheating accusations that caused immense pressure. Naroditsky, who called Kramnik "worse than dirt," experienced severe mental health impacts from the public harassment. The chess world mourns the loss of a bright light whose accessibility to millions was affected by these unfounded allegations.

title: 3 lakhs and counting! Anaya Bangar shares Diwali photo with father; pens heartfelt note
content: Anaya Bangar shared a heartwarming Diwali photo with her father, Sanjay Bangar, and family, sparking widespread attention.  Earlier this year, Anaya revealed her struggle to play cricket after her father's assertion of no place for her, leading to suicidal thoughts and a fight for her identity. She continues advocating for inclusivity in sports.

title: ‚ÄòBreak her legs‚Äô: Pragya Thakur tells parents to punish daughters for meeting ‚Äònon-Hindus‚Äô
content: Former Bhopal MP Pragya Singh Thakur has sparked controversy with remarks advising parents to physically punish daughters who visit non-Hindu homes, even suggesting "breaking their legs." Speaking at a religious event, Thakur urged parents to enforce obedience and values, stating that punishment is necessary for their well-being.

title: Items unverified for 40 yrs: Ivory, gold & valuables ‚Äòmissing‚Äô from Guruvayur temple; key findings
content: Audits reveal alarming lapses in Guruvayur Devaswom's management of temple valuables, including gold, silver, and ivory. Poor recordkeeping and missing documentation have left precious assets vulnerable to misuse. Despite legal requirements, physical verification of valuables has been neglected for decades, raising concerns about accountability and potential misappropriation.

title: Diwali bonus row causes chaos on Agra-Lucknow Expressway; toll gates flung open
content: Toll gates on the Agra-Lucknow Expressway were opened by protesting workers demanding a higher Diwali bonus, causing thousands of vehicles to pass without payment. Police intervened, leading to discussions where the company agreed to a 10% salary hike, restoring operations after a two-hour disruption.

title: Perth warning: Rohit, Kohli, and Iyer show cracks ahead of India‚Äôs 2027 ODI plans
content: India‚Äôs star batters -- Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli, and Shreyas Iyer -- struggled in Perth, scoring just 19 runs between them against Australia in the first ODI in Perth. Limited match practice and absence from multiple formats exposed the technical flaws, raising concerns ahead of the 2027 ODI World Cup in South Africa.

title: Punjab shocker: Ex-DGP, wife booked over son‚Äôs suspicious death; video sparks probe
content: Former Punjab DGP Mohammad Mustafa and his wife, ex-minister Razia Sultana, are among four booked by Haryana Police in connection with their son Akil Akhter's death. Akhter was found dead under suspicious circumstances, with social media posts alleging threats to his life. A Special Investigation Team has been formed to probe the matter.

title: LeBron James escapes lawsuit after fan claims he was ‚Äòduped‚Äô by fake retirement tease
content: A Los Angeles Lakers fan has withdrawn his lawsuit against LeBron James. The fan claimed he lost money after believing James' teaser video meant retirement. He bought expensive tickets for a game. The announcement was for a liquor advertisement. PrizePicks offered him free tickets and merchandise. This convinced him to drop the case.

title: 'Clear evidence attack was by Pakistan': ACB spokesperson on airstrike in Paktika
content: Afghanistan's cricket board has pulled out of a tri-series in Pakistan after accusing Islamabad of an airstrike that killed three Afghan cricketers.  The ACB spokesperson demanded global condemnation, citing evidence of Pakistani involvement.  National players reportedly support the withdrawal, with Zimbabwe replacing Afghanistan in the tournament.

title: Golden State Warriors unveil 2025‚Äì26 roster featuring Stephen Curry & Jimmy Butler
content: The Golden State Warriors have revealed their 2025-26 Opening Night roster, featuring Stephen Curry, Jimmy Butler, and Jonathan Kuminga. They will face the Los Angeles Lakers on October 21, who will be without LeBron James due to sciatica. This matchup marks Jimmy Butler's return after an ankle injury, and the Warriors aim to make a statement on opening night.

title: ‚ÄòKantara Chapter 1‚Äô box office collection day 20 (live): Ayushmann Khurrana's 'Thamma' outperforms Rishab Shetty starrer in Tuesday earnings
content: Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' continues its impressive box office run, nearing Rs 550 crore. Despite strong performance, the film was outperformed on Tuesday by the new Diwali release, 'Thamma', which garnered over Rs 13 crore on its opening day.

title: Sarfaraz misses out; Pant recovers to be named captain of India A vs South Africa A - complete squads
content: Rishabh Pant will lead the India A squad in two four-day matches against South Africa A. This marks Pant's return after recovering from a toe injury sustained in England. He was previously named in the Delhi Ranji Trophy squad but may miss that fixture. The matches are scheduled for October 30 and November 6 in Bengaluru.

title: NASA opens SpaceX moon lander contract to rivals amid Starship delays
content: NASA is opening its prestigious Artemis 3 moon landing contract to new bidders, including Blue Origin, due to delays with SpaceX's Starship. This move aims to ensure a timely return to the Moon amid intensifying international competition, particularly from China. The agency seeks accelerated proposals to maintain US leadership in space exploration.

title: Muhurat trading 2025: Nifty50 closes above 25,800; Sensex up nearly 63 points
content: Stock market today on Muhurat trading 2025: The NSE Nifty increased by 25.45 points or 0.10 per cent, ending at 25,868.60, with 25 stocks declining, 24 advancing, and one remaining stable.

title: Delhi air pollution worsens: Tracking city‚Äôs AQI over 10 Diwalis; this year is just as toxic
content: Delhi residents woke to thick grey haze as air quality turned 'very poor' post-Diwali. Many burst firecrackers beyond the Supreme Court's limit. Pollution levels reached 'severe' in several areas. This follows a trend of poor air quality after Diwali celebrations in previous years, highlighting the impact of fireworks on existing pollution.

title: Why Rizwan was removed as Pakistan captain - shocking inside details
content: Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Mohammad Rizwan has been removed as ODI captain, replaced by Shaheen Shah Afridi. Sources told TimesofIndia.com that Rizwan‚Äôs refusal to promote betting companies led to his ouster, despite his strong performances. Former captain Rashid Latif slammed the PCB, hinting at ideological bias, as Shaheen prepares to lead Pakistan against South Africa in Faisalabad.

title: IMD warns of heavy rain, thunderstorms & flood risk across several states
content: Southern and eastern India are bracing for a week of intense rainfall and thunderstorms, with the IMD predicting widespread showers and heavy downpours through October 26. Northeast monsoon activity is surging, prompting flash flood warnings for several districts in Tamil Nadu, Kerala, and Andhra Pradesh. Residents are urged to exercise caution.

title: ‚ÄòPurification‚Äô over namaz at Shaniwarwada: ASI officer files plaint against 3 women; NCP seeks action
content: BJP MP Medha Kulkarni faced strong criticism from NCP and Shiv Sena for protesting and 'purifying' Shaniwarwada after Muslim women offered namaz. The NCP demanded a police case against her, alleging she disturbed communal harmony. The incident led to police deployment at the historic site.

title: Fight erupts in Texans vs Seahawks as Stingley Jr. knocks off Smith-Njigba‚Äôs helmet
content: Tempers flared between the Texans and Seahawks as Derek Stingley Jr. was flagged for unnecessary roughness after knocking Jaxon Smith-Njigba's helmet off following an interception. The penalty shifted momentum, impacting the Texans' drive. This intense moment highlighted the high stakes and discipline challenges in a pivotal Week 7 matchup.

title: Hardik Pandya-Mahieka Sharma make it official? Diwali celebration wins the internet
content: Indian cricketer Hardik Pandya and model Mahieka Sharma have confirmed their relationship, appearing together at a Diwali celebration in coordinated red outfits. This public outing follows recent glimpses of their beach birthday getaway and airport sightings, putting an end to months of speculation about their romance.

title: Top picks for Samvat 2082: Muhurat trading today ‚Äì 10 stocks for up to 38% returns
content: As India enters Samvat 2082, Motilal Oswal Financial Services analysts highlight a strong growth phase for Nifty earnings, projecting an 8% rise in FY26 and 16% in FY27. Muhurat Trading 2025 could signal market recovery, with the brokerage listing top stock picks like SBI, M&M, and BEL for potential gains up to 38%.

title: 'Only Congress will respect Nitish‚Äô: Pappu Yadav accuses BJP of isolating CM
content: Congress MP Pappu Yadav claims the BJP-led NDA is sidelining Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar. He stated that only the Congress party will offer Kumar the respect he deserves. Yadav believes Kumar will not remain with the NDA after the upcoming Bihar elections. Bihar is scheduled to vote in November.

content: Beginning Friday with Game 1, it's the defending champs vs. a franchise that hasn't won in more than three decades. Here's your first look at an L.A.-Toronto showdown.

content: Bryant Wesco Jr., Clemson's leading receiver, will miss the rest of the season after sustaining a back injury against SMU this past weekend.

content: Texans wideout Nico Collins suffered a concussion against the Seahawks on Monday night, coach DeMeco Ryans said after the game.

title: Nicklaus awarded $50 million in defamation suit
content: A Florida jury on Monday awarded Jack Nicklaus $50 million in his defamation lawsuit against Nicklaus Companies, which is owned by billionaire banker Howard Milstein.

title: Cops: Ex-RB Martin died in custody after break-in
content: Former NFL All-Pro running back Doug Martin died in police custody after he was involved in a break-in at an Oakland residence, police said.

title: Campbell: 'No looking back' after Gibbs' breakout
content: Lions running back Jahmyr Gibbs had two touchdowns and a career-best 218 scrimmage yards in Monday night's win over the Buccaneers.

content: Buccaneers receiver Mike Evans suffered a broken collarbone and concussion Monday night at Detroit and will be out most of the year, coach Todd Bowles said.

content: The noise level remained high at 72 decibel between 10 p.m. on Monday to 6 a.m. on Tuesday, Jharkhand State Pollution Control Board said.

content: On Police Commemoration Day, S.‚ÄØVenkateswar pays tribute to fallen officers and urges citizens to honour and support their families.

title: Ashok accuses Congress of distracting from government failures
content: Leader of the Opposition in the Legislative Assembly R. Ashok has alleged that the Congress government raised the issue of the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh only to hide its failures in the last two-and-a-half years

title: Watch: Northeast monsoon hits early, Tamil Nadu braces for heavy rain
content: The northeast monsoon has arrived four days early, triggering intense rainfall across Tamil Nadu. With all 13 shutters of the Mullaperiyar Dam open, floodwaters are surging into Theni and surrounding districts. Overlapping monsoons from Kerala and Tamil Nadu are amplifying the risk, flooding farmlands, homes, and roads. Experts warn that excess rain is no longer a blessing in a changing climate. Urban flooding, crop damage, and infrastructure stress are rising, highlighting the urgent need for better water management.

title: Hyderabad paediatrician warns of renewed risk as Delhi HC allows sale of existing ‚ÄòORSL‚Äô stock amid FSSAI order
content: If the companies wish to clear their remaining stock, it should be done only in supermarkets, and even then, the label must not mention ‚ÄòORS‚Äô, says Sivaranjani Santosh

content: CMD of Southern Discom, Md. Musharraf Faruqui, inspects vehicle parking areas on Secretariat premises to explore possibility for EV charging stations

content: DGP Gaurav Yadav said the grenade was intended for a ‚Äútargeted terror attack‚Äù and preliminary probe has revealed that the accused were in contact with an operative of Pakistan‚Äôs ISI

title: Assam government extends financial aid to victims of Baksa jail violence
content: Civilians, police personnel and media persons were injured when violence erupted during transportation of the five accused in Zubeen Garg‚Äôs death to Baksa jail last week.

title: EU, Ukraine Back Trumps Peace Plan, Call For More Pressure On Putin
content: European leaders issued a joint statement with Ukraine on Tuesday backing US President Donald Trump's call for peace talks to begin based on the current frontline with Russia.

title: MK Stalin Reviews Preparedness As Tamil Nadu Braces For Heavy Rains
content: As the northeast monsoon intensifies over Tamil Nadu, Chief Minister MK Stalin reviewed the state's preparedness to tackle heavy rains and directed district administrations to stay on high alert.

title: 9 Trans People Attempt Suicide In Mumbai Over Remarks On Spiritual Leader
content: Nine people - all of them transgenders -- allegedly tried to die by suicide in Mumbai in protest against derogatory comments made by some people against their spiritual leader, Salma Khan, and the non-profit Kinnar Maa Sansthan.

title: BJP Leader Compares Mamata Banerjee To Mir Jafar, Says No Compassion
content: Former Tripura Chief Minister and Lok Sabha MP Biplab Kumar Deb - known for his unfiltered comments -- launched a scathing attack on West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee today, saying she has turned into a "demon".

title: Body Of RG Kar Rape Convict's 11-Year-Old Niece Found In Cupboard At Her Home
content: Tension flared in the city's Bhowanipore area on Tuesday after enraged locals assaulted the father and stepmother of an 11-year-old girl whose body was recovered in a partially hanging manner from a cupboard at their home a day earlier.

title: Tata Trusts Reappoints Venu Srinivasan, Focus Now On Mehli Mistry Amid Rifts
content: Tata Trusts has unanimously reappointed Venu Srinivasan as a trustee for life, and all eyes are now on the upcoming decision regarding Mehli Mistry's renewal, amid reported internal divisions within the organisation.

title: Canadian Paraglider Who Crashed In Himachal's Dhauladhar Ranges Found Dead
content: The body of the 27-year-old Canadian paraglider who had crashed into the Dhauladhar ranges has been brought to Kangra, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Workout Video Of Druglord In Raipur Jail Goes Viral, Raises Security Concerns
content: The Raipur Central Jail is in the spotlight once again after a video of an alleged drug kingpin working out went viral.

title: Video: Woman Repeatedly Slaps Security Guard In Greater Noida Complex
content: A video is being widely shared in which a woman can be seen repeatedly slapping the security guard of a housing complex in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida.

title: India 'Has Much To Do' To Stop Toxic Cough Syrup Sales, Says WHO
content: India has more work to do in halting sales of toxic cough syrup, despite some progress, a World Health Organisation official told Reuters, after at least 24 children died following consumption of a domestically-made medicine.

title: IndiGo To Resume Flights From Delhi Airport's Terminal 2 From October 26
content: IndiGo will resume operations from Terminal 2 of Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport starting October 26 after a temporary shift earlier this year due to maintenance work, India's low-cost carrier said on Tuesday.

title: DK Shivakumar Slams BJP's Criticism, Says 10,000 Bengaluru Potholes Fixed
content: DK Shivakumar launched a sharp counterattack against the BJP over criticism of the city's infrastructure, asserting that no other government in the country has empowered citizens to directly report civic issues like potholes and garbage.

title: After Decade On Death Row In Indonesia, British Grandmother To Return Home
content: Indonesia signed an agreement on Tuesday to repatriate two British nationals, including a seriously ill grandmother on death row for more than a decade on drug charges, a minister said.

title: White House Tears Down Historic East Wing To Build Trump's Ballroom
content: The White House started tearing down part of the East Wing on Monday, the traditional base of operations for the first lady, to build President Donald Trump's $250 million ballroom.

title: The Audacity Of Tejashwi Yadav's Ambition: Shifting From 'MY' To 'PDA'
content: In the intricate smorgasbord of Bihar's political landscape, the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) has long stood as a formidable player, its roots entrenched in the soil of the Muslim-Yadav coalition.

title: Delhi Hospitals Report Dozens Of Burn Injury Cases After Diwali
content: Hospitals across the national capital reported a surge in burn injuries after Diwali celebrations on Tuesday, with dozens of patients admitted due to firecracker-related accidents. canva

title: Prashant Kishor's Threat Charge Against BJP After 3 Jan Suraaj Desertions
content: Accusing the BJP of intimidating Jan Suraaj Party candidates, poll strategist-turned-politician Prashant Kishor today said three candidates of his party were pressured into withdrawing their nomination for the upcoming Bihar election

title: "Only Way To Save Lives": Upholding Gaza Ceasefire "Vital", Says UN
content: Maintaining the Gaza ceasefire is critical for delivering life-saving food aid in the territory, the United Nations said Tuesday, repeating a call for all border crossings to be opened.

title: "Gajab Aadmi Hai": Tejashwi Yadav's Swipe At Nitish Kumar Over Viral Video
content: With two weeks left for Bihar to vote in the Assembly election, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav has taken a fresh swipe at Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's health after a video of him garlanding a woman at a public meeting circulated

title: Not A Fan Of iPhone's New Liquid Glass Look? Apple To Roll Out Fix Soon
content: Apple has introduced a new way for iPhone users to adjust how the Liquid Glass interface appears on their screens. With the latest iOS 26.1 beta 4 update, users can now choose to reduce the transparency effect of iOS 26.

title: Lokpal wants seven BMW cars, floats tender
content: The Lokpal at present has seven members, including a chairman and six members ‚Äî against its sanctioned strength of eight

title: T.N. to amend rules to allow women workers in¬†‚Äòdangerous operations‚Äô in factories
content: A notification of the draft amendments to the Tamil Nadu Factories Rules was issued by the Labour Welfare and Skill Development Department last month

title: Delhi government blames Punjab AAP regime for toxic haze after Deepavali, says crackers not responsible
content: "We admit with pride that our government has given people the opportunity to celebrate Deepavali in the traditional way," Environment Minister Manjinder Singh Sirsa said

title: CPI(M) extends an olive branch to CPI over  differences on seeking PM-SHRI funds linked to complying with NEP
content: CPI(M) general secretary M.A. Baby says Kerala will seek PM-SHRI funds without implementing NEP. CPI‚Äôs fears about NEP are not misplaced but State needs the funds. LDF will discuss the issue, he says

title: Uttar Pradesh sends 1,000 quintals wheat seeds to flood-hit Punjab farmers
content: According to an official statement, the Chief Minister noted Punjab's pivotal role in achieving agricultural self-sufficiency in India.

title: Five projects to be taken up under Urban Rejuvenation and City Beautification Scheme in Thiruvananthapuram
content: The scheme, with an expenditure of ‚Çπ100 crore, was announced in the 2023-24 State Budget, with similar schemes for the other city Corporations of Kerala.

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Nitish launches campaign, takes swipe at Lalu for doing ‚Äònothing for women‚Äô
content: The JD(U) president, who is seeking a record fifth consecutive term in office, was addressing his maiden election rally in Minapur constituency of Muzaffarpur district

title: Northeast monsoon: Tamil Nadu requests Centre to relax permissible moisture content for paddy procurement
content: Chief Minister M.K. Stalin reviewed the monsoon preparations undertaken in Chennai, Tiruvallur, Kancheepuram and Chengalpattu districts and in the Cauvery delta region.

title: Divided by politics: Three 'Aga' candidates lock horns for Budgam bypoll
content: The contest for the seat comes after Chief Minister Omar Abdullah chose to retain Ganderbal following the 2024 assembly polls

title: Four killed, 10 injured in fire at building in Navi Mumbai
content: After being alerted, 40 fire brigade personnel along with 8 fire tenders and police rushed to the spot and the blaze was put out by 4 a.m., the official said

title: Efforts underway to neutralise foreign terrorists hiding in Jammu forests: IGP
content: Terrorists and criminals are using new technology like drones in an attempt to break the security grid, but the security agencies are two steps ahead of them to maintain the internal security, says IGP

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Prashant Kishor alleges three candidates of his party withdrew under BJP‚Äôs ‚Äòpressure‚Äô
content: The candidates who withdrew from the race were fielded in the Danapur, Brahampur, and Gopalganj seats, he said

title: Three women booked for offering namaz inside Shaniwar wada in Pune after video goes viral
content: FIR has been filed under provisions of the Ancient Monuments and Archaeological Sites and Remains (AMASR) Rules, 1959, for allegedly violating restrictions applicable to protected monuments, says Pune City police

title: HMDA registers 245% rise in permit fee collection this year; skyscrapers lead growth
content: The permit fee collections in 2025 till September was ‚Çπ1,225 crore, and ‚Çπ355 crore in 2024 and ‚Çπ674 crore in 2023

title: Flash floods inundate houses, shop at Cherupuzha as heavy rain batters hilly areas of Kannur in Kerala
content: Local residents said water levels rose rapidly following hours of intense rainfall in upper catchment areas

title: K-Rail route likely to be revised, says CPI(M) Kerala secretary M.V. Govindan
content: Govindan says a new approach is necessary since the Centre has not yet approved the existing proposal

title: Police Commemoration Day observed in Villupuram, Cuddalore, Kallakurichi
content: The Police Commemoration Day is observed on October 21 every year to pay respects to the 10 policemen who were killed by Chinese troops in an ambush at Hot Springs in Ladakh in 1959.

title: Heavy rains likely in Kerala as low-pressure area intensifies; orange alert for five districts on October 21
content: New weather system is likely to trigger heavy to very heavy rainfall across Kerala, especially in Ghat regions. Red alert issued for Idukki, Palakkad and Malappuram on Wednesday

title: Principal, teachers of Bengaluru private school booked on charge of assaulting Class 5 student
content: When questioned, the school management allegedly justified their act stating:  ‚ÄúThis is how we discipline in our school. If you don‚Äôt like it, take the TC and leave‚Äú

title: Air quality dips in Kolkata, Howrah after Deepavali celebrations
content: Police arrested 640 persons for violations; environmentalists said regulations¬†remain¬†on paper, implementation lagged; Kolkata Police Commissioner said situation is better than in other years

title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy pledges full support to families of police personnel killed in line of duty
content: The Chief Minister announced an ex-gratia of ‚Çπ1 crore to family of constable E Pramod Kumar ‚Äî who was recently killed in Nizamabad ‚Äî along with his last drawn salary until retirement, a government job for a family member, and a 300-yard house plot

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin participates in Police Commemoration Day
content: This is the first time the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu has participated in the Police Commemoration Day event.

title: Trump brushed aside MEA's attempts at denial: Congress after U.S. President repeats 'Russian oil import' claims
content: The Congress on October 18, 2025 had said the PM suddenly becomes a "mauni baba" whenever Donald Trump states that he stopped India-Pakistan conflict or that India will reduce its oil imports from Russia

title: Deepavali truce? Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw visits Karnataka DCM D.K. Shivakumar at his residence
content: The meeting has turned heads as it comes after a bitter exchange between the two after Ms Shaw‚Äôs criticism on the poor state of infrastructure in Bengaluru.

title: Kerala School Athletic Meet set to kick off in Thiruvananthapuram on October 22
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan to flag off field and track competitions at a curtain-raiser event at Kerala University Stadium on Tuesday evening

title: Parvez Rasool, J&K‚Äôs first international cricketer, retires
content: He said that though he was stepping away from professional cricket, he would continue to ‚Äúplay for passion‚Äù and guide youngsters

title: FIR against ex-Punjab DGP, his wife in connection with their son‚Äôs death
content: Haryana Police filed an FIR against former Punjab DGP Mohammad Mustafa and others following the suspicious death of his son, Aqil Akhtar, with allegations of murder and conspiracy surfacing

title: ‚ÄòModerate‚Äô air quality recorded in Kochi after Deepavali
content: Overall AQI was 83 in Kochi around 12 noon on Tuesday, as per data available under AQI tracker in Google Maps

title: Well-marked low pressure area forms over Bay of Bengal, to trigger intense rainfall in Tamil Nadu
content: The Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC), Chennai has sounded orange and yellow alerts for various parts of the State for the next four days

title: Kerala CM inaugurates new Palayam market in Kozhikode amid protests
content: Pinarayi Vijayan criticises ‚Äòattitude of opposing projects that are meant for the betterment of society‚Äô

title: Crime is more organised, invisible, and complex now; its purpose is to create chaos: Rajnath Singh
content: The number of districts affected by Left Wing Extremism has fallen drastically, the Union Defence Minister said, commending the police and security forces for their contribution to eliminating Naxalism

title: Two cars destroyed in blaze triggered by firecrackers in Mumbai
content: No person was injured in the blaze reported to the fire brigade at 11.33 p.m. on October 20 at the Neelyog Vedanta building near Arogyadayi Hospital, a civic official said

title: Mettur Dam¬†reaches full capacity for¬†seventh¬†time this year
content: 30,000 cusecs of surplus water is being released into Cauvery river as on October 21. Flood alert has been issued to 11 districts in the delta region.

title: Success in Operation Sindoor, fight against Naxalism, GST reforms show India as symbol of stability: PM Modi
content: Amid historic achievements, the country had also embarked on next-generation reforms in recent days, Modi said in an open letter to citizens on the occasion of Deepavali

title: Watch: This Tamil Nadu village celebrates bats as protectors
content: In Royandapuram, Tamil Nadu, silence reigns during festivals‚Äînot out of restraint, but reverence. Home to 1,500 sacred bats, this village believes these creatures bring prosperity and protection.

title: Watch: Ola founder Bhavish Aggarwal booked over engineer‚Äôs death
content: A case was filed against Ola Electric founder Bhavish Aggarwal and senior officials after the death of 38-year-old engineer K. Aravind, who allegedly faced workplace harassment and unpaid dues.

title: Air quality remains ‚Äòstable‚Äô in Kerala capital after Deepavali
content: Kerala capital‚Äôs average AQI recorded at Plamoodu was 76 on Tuesday morning, with air quality returning to ‚Äòstable‚Äô category, whereas it was 168 AQI (moderate category) at the same time on Monday

title: Naidu pays tributes to Police Martyrs, vows full support to maintain law and order
content: Mr. Naidu said that maintaining proper law and order is essential for attracting investments and fostering confidence among industries

title: Delhi‚Äôs air pollution 15 times WHO limit; capitalcity reels under ‚Äòsevere‚Äô pollution
content: Delhi ‚Äòmost polluted‚Äô major city in the world on Tuesday (October 21, 2025) morning, according to IQAir‚Äôs (a Swiss air quality technology company) live data for over 120 cities

title: India rains LIVE: Low pressure area forms over Bay of Bengal, likely to cause heavy rainfall in Tamil Nadu
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on October 20 said a low pressure area is likely to form over the Bay of Bengal

title: 11 districts in Kerala brace for intense rains on October 21
content: The IMD has issued a yellow alert for Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam, Ernakulam, Idukki, Thrissur, Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode and Wayanad

title: Bihar Assembly election LIVE: Prashant Kishor says three Jan Suraaj Party candidates withdraw under BJP 'pressure'; Nitish Kumar launches poll campaign
content: Jan Suraaj Party chief Prashant Kishor alleged that three candidates of his party in the Bihar elections withdrew their nominations under "pressure" from the BJP.

title: Govt Medical College, hospital will come up in Puttur at any cost, reiterates Chief Minister
content: Siddaramaiah appeals to people of Dakshina Kannada to elect Congress to power in all eight Assembly segments in the next election

title: Truckers, commercial vehicle operators call for 4-day strike to protest bad roads in Mizoram
content: The blockade will be spearheaded by the Kolasib unit of the Mizoram Tipper Association (MTA) and Joint Action Committee (JAC) of drivers and owners of commercial vehicles in Kolasib town

title: US visa chaos: New norms offer relief - who is exempt from paying $100k fee?
content: Lubna Kably is a senior editor, who focuses on various policies and legislation. In particular, she writes extensively on immigration and tax policies. The Indian diaspora is the largest in the world; through her articles she demystifies the immigration-policy related developments in select countries for outbound students, job aspirants and employees. She also analyses the impact of Income-tax and GST related developments for individuals and business entities. Read More

title: Lions knock Bucs out of first in NFC behind Gibbs' big night
content: Detroit running back Jahmyr Gibbs scores 78 yards in 24-9 win over the Tampa Bay Buccaneers . the Lions are now 13-4 after a loss since the start of the 2022 campaign . despite playing without starting safeties Kerby Joseph (knee) and Brian Branch (suspension)

title: Graham ends retirement, agrees to rejoin Eagles
content: Brandon Graham has agreed to a one-year deal to suit up for his 16th season with the Eagles . he was the longest-tenured player in franchise history . his return comes on the heels of Za'Darius Smith's sudden retirement last week .

title: MMA divisional rankings: How did Brendan Allen upsetting Reinier de Ridder shake things up?
content: reinier de Ridder is now ahead of the top-ranked middleweight . he's the only other weight class with changes in these rankings is heavyweight, because Francis Ngannou has not fought in just over a year and was removed as ineligible .

title: CFP Bubble Watch: Who's in, who's out, who has work to do after Week 8
content: a team with Would be in status is featured in this week's top 12 projection . teams listed as On the cusp are the true bubble teams and the first ones outside the bracket . one team with Work to do is passing the eye test and has a chance at winning its conference .

title: NHL rink report: Matthew Schaefer's hot start, Tusky's debut, games of the week
content: no. 1 draft pick has had quite the debut in the NHL, hasn't he? he started his NHL career with a five-game point streak (and counting) that's the second-longest point streak by any defenseman from the start of their career .
